method.text: Cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy
Using fork, gradually stir in flour and semolina
Draw mixture together with finger tips
Press into lightly buttered tin, and prick well all over
Bake in centre of 160Â°C oven until very lightly browned, about 40 minutes
Leave in the tin for 5 minutes, then cut into triangles and dust with extra caster sugar
Leave too cool before removing from tin

notes.text: This is now a bit away from mums. I think she uses no semolina, mixes the flour in with the mixer, kneads it a bit, rolls it out thin and then cuts the shortbread. She also bakes it with almost no color.
Shortbread House of Edinburgh has a video, which reveals a few hints. Dough seems soft, like it's been kneaded slightly. Appears to be mushed out by hand, rolled with a dimpler, then hand cut

New Forest Shortbread have a video that shows it being made. Dough is again soft, rolled into logs, (video may show dough being chilled), then sliced into rounds. Again looks like it's rolled in demerara sugar
